channel.title: Galápagos on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Galápagos on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.title: Naturally acquired antibodies to tetanus toxin in humans and animals from the Galápagos islands
item.description: The level of tetanus antibodies of 57 tested residents of Galapagos Islands was above the protective level. None of them had been vaccinated. Two of them have had tetanus in the past. This contradicts the accepted dogma that having had the disease does not give immunity. They also checked nine animals (horses, cows, donkeys and a dog) and all of them had sufficient levels of antibodies. The authors believe that immunity is produced by swallowing bacterial spores that multiply in the intestines.
